item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 17, 2024 at 1:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Bpftune uses BPF to auto-tune Linux systems (42 points | 11 comments)
2. All-in-one embedding model for interleaved text, images, and screenshots (115 points | 12 comments)
3. Constraints in Go (58 points | 25 comments)
4. CSS gets a new logo and it uses the color `rebeccapurple` (479 points | 90 comments)
5. The Bluesky firehose viewed in the style of a Windows XP screensaver (348 points | 85 comments)
6. Show HN: Zyme – An Evolvable Programming Language (21 points | 3 comments)

10. SICP: The only computer science book worth reading twice? (2010) (358 points | 138 comments)
11. Teach yourself to echolocate (2018) (171 points | 42 comments)
12. Two galaxies aligned in a way where their gravity acts as a compound lens (231 points | 73 comments)

14. Effect of a giant meteorite impact on Paleoarchean environment and life (116 points | 44 comments)
15. How we made a Ruby method 200x faster (30 points | 18 comments)

19. DIMM vs. Udimm vs. Rdimm vs. Sodimm vs. Cudimm: What's the Difference? (15 points | 2 comments)
20. Show HN: Knight's Graph – game based on the Knight's tour problem (6 points | 1 comment)
21. Yggdrasil Network (282 points | 94 comments)

25. One-parting some Commodore 64 utilities for fun and profit (29 points | 6 comments)
26. Statistical Rethinking (2024 Edition) (162 points | 26 comments)
27. When Abstractions Break (22 points | 4 comments)
28. Appreciation of the mark-all-as-read button (40 points | 25 comments)
29. Resolving a mysterious problem with find (27 points | 30 comments)
